abstract.p: List of organizations that can provide information about solar power (S)

block.p: HERE are organizations that can provide information about solar power:

American Solar Energy Society, 2400 Central Avenue, Suite G-1, Boulder, Colo. 80301 (www.ases.org). Sponsors nationwide tours of solar homes and provides links to several other renewable-energy Web sites.
HERE are organizations that can provide information about solar power:

American Solar Energy Society, 2400 Central Avenue, Suite G-1, Boulder, Colo. 80301 (www.ases.org). Sponsors nationwide tours of solar homes and provides links to several other renewable-energy Web sites.

North Carolina Solar Energy Center, North Carolina State University, Raleigh, N.C. 27695 (www.dcs.ncsu.edu/solar/dsire/ dsire.html). Lists information resources on state incentives for renewable energy.

Million Solar Roofs Initiative of the United States Department of Energy, Washington (www.eren.doe.gov/millionroofs). Provides information about a government initiative for installing one million solar roofs by 2010.
Environmental Defense Foundation, 257 Park Avenue South, New York, N.Y. 10010 (www.environmentaldefense.org). Follows environmental issues.
Altair Energy, Golden, Colo. (www.altairenergy.com). Provides solar systems in the West.
